thread.title: Vitality home nations rugby tickets: terms and conditions
thread.title_full: Vitality home nations rugby tickets: terms and conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Vitality home nations rugby tickets: terms and conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Vitality Corporate Services Limited (“Vitality”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the prize draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the entrant agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. To enter this prize draw, entrants must submit their details on the entry form at www.telegraph.co.uk/vitalityrugby and select which prize they would like to win. Entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winners will be drawn at random from all entries received by the Closing Date. The winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a stamped addressed envelope to Vitality Rugby Prize Draw Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the Closing Date. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday, November 29, 2015 (“Closing Date”). 6. The winners will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone or email within 14 days of the Closing Date. Should the Promoter be unable to contact a winner or should a winner be unable to accept their prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award that prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prizes as described are available on the date of publication. Should a prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. The prizes are as follow: Tickets to a Wales home match during Six Nations 2016 One winner will win: • Two tickets to a Wales home match at Principality Stadium during the Six Nations 2016 tournament on a date to be confirmed by the Promoter; • Two tickets to attend the Captain’s Run training session at the Principality Stadium on the day before the match; • Two nights’ four star hotel accommodation for two, based on two people sharing a twin or double room (meals not included); and • A travel allowance of up to £50 inclusive per person. Tickets to a Scotland home match during Six Nations 2016 One winner will win: • Two tickets to a Scotland home match at BT Murrayfield during the Six Nations 2016 tournament on a date to be confirmed by the Promoter; • Two tickets to attend the Captain’s Run training session at BT Murrayfield on the day before the match; • Two nights’ four star hotel accommodation for two, based on two people sharing a twin or double room on a room-only basis; and • Travel allowance of up to £50 per person. Tickets to England v Wales during Six Nations 2016 Three winners will each win: • One pair of tickets to the England v Wales match at Twickenham on March 12, 2016. 9. The winners must take their prize as one package. 10. Except where otherwise stated, the prizes do not include travel, accommodation, food and drink, personal expenditure or incidental costs. 11. The prizes are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 12. The winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of Vitality and the Promoter. 13. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 14. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prizes impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 15. The Promoter is responsible for the publication, administration and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prizes is the responsibility of Vitality Corporate Services Limited, 3 More London Riverside, London SE1 2AQ. 16. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
